name: Bash
description: Run a Bash script on macOS, Linux, or Windows
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2132213) or [see the Bash documentation](https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/)
author: Microsoft Corporation
releaseNotes: Script task consistency. Added support for multiple lines and added support for Windows.

inputs.name: targetType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target script type: File Path or Inline

inputs.name: filePath
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script to execute. Must be a fully qualified path or relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory).

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the shell script. Either ordinal parameters or named parameters.

inputs.name: script
inputs.label: Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# Write your commands here

echo 'Hello world'

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the StandardError stream.

inputs.name: noProfile
inputs.label: Don't load the profile startup/initialization files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Don't load the system-wide startup file `/etc/profile' or any of the personal initialization files
